author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Repo URL does not end with /name.jl.git, where name is the package name

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->

> Repo URL does not end with /name.jl.git, where name is the package name

I suppose I should write Actors.jl instead of actors.jl

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

body:
- Registering package: Actors
- Repository: https://gitlab.com/Palethorpe/Actors.jl
- Created by: https://gitlab.com/Palethorpe
- Version: v0.0.1
- Commit: 284b2695683ef58bb8dbcff15363d581090d6ebb
- Git reference: master
- Release notes:
<!-- BEGIN RELEASE NOTES -->
> This is a prototype for people to experiment with. It was originally called Luvvy, however Actors was made available and it seems people prefer this name.
> 
> https://discourse.julialang.org/t/luvvy-use-actors-liberally-for-robust-highly-parallel-julia-code-prototype/30086
> 
> Requires at least Julia 1.3.
<!-- END RELEASE NOTES -->
title: New package: Actors v0.0.1
